template.template: Template UBNT UniFi Controller v5 pass
template.name: Template UBNT UniFi Controller v5 pass
template.description:
Template for UBNT UniFi Controller by zbx.sadman@gmail.com Tested with controller v5.x, Zabbix v 2.4.
https://github.com/zbx-sadman/unifi_proxy
Requirements: unifi_proxy >= v1.3.5
aptitude install libjson-perl libjson-xs-perl libwww-perl libio-socket-ssl-perl libdata-dumper-simple-perl libtime-hires-perl
aptitude bring a-lot-of-beer

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" ATF enabled
item_prototype.description: ATF - Air Time Fairness (?)

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" clients with very good signal
[{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" clients with very low signal
[{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" connected clients
item_prototype.description: Amount of clients (users+guests) connected to UAP

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" connected clients (MAC)
item_prototype.description: Amount of clients (users+guests) connected to UAP

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" connected guests
item_prototype.description: Number of guests (clients in guest networks) connected to UAP

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" Connected users
item_prototype.description: Number of users connected to UAP

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" firmware version
item_prototype.description: Current firmware version

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" model
item_prototype.description: Model of UAP: BZ2 - UAP BZ2LR - UAP LR ...

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" RX drops
item_prototype.description:
rx_dropped; /* no space in linux buffers */
The number of packets dropped during reception.
The bottom line is that the high RX error rate is due to Radio interferences from neighboring Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, Cordless phones, Cellular phones, Speakers, Microwave Ovens, Fans, and even Florescent lamps. If this is happening to your AP, you may want to tweak the Channel, Bluetooth coexistence mode, and dissociate the AP from any sources of interference.

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" RX errors
item_prototype.description: rx_errors; /* bad packets received */

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" serial number
item_prototype.description: Serial number of UAP

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" state
[{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" TX drops
item_prototype.description:
tx_dropped; /* no space available in linux */
The number of packets dropped during transmission.

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" TX errors
item_prototype.description: tx_errors; /* packet transmit problems */

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" TX retries
item_prototype.description:
Number of times sending frame is retried without considering it a transmission failure.
Data rate is decreased upon failure and frame is sent again. Three sequential failures on lowest supported rate suspend transmission to this destination for the duration of on-fail-retry-time. After that, frame is sent again. The frame is being retransmitted until transmission success, or until client is disconnected after disconnect-timeout.

graph_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" expected loss of clients with MinRSSI

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UGW "{#NAME}" LAN interface full duplex state
[{#SITEDESC}] UGW "{#NAME}" LAN network DHCP guard enabled
[{#SITEDESC}] UGW "{#NAME}" LAN network IGMP snooping enabled
[{#SITEDESC}] UGW "{#NAME}" state
[{#SITEDESC}] UGW "{#NAME}" WAN connection type
item_prototype.description: type:"dhcp" for example

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UGW "{#NAME}" WAN interface full duplex state
[{#DESC}] Configure VOIP port as WAN2 on UniFi Security Gateway 3P
[{#DESC}] DPI incoming traffic - Mail and Collaboration
[{#DESC}] DPI incoming traffic - Voice over IP
[{#DESC}] DPI outgoing traffic - Mail and Collaboration
[{#DESC}] DPI outgoing traffic - Voice over IP
[{#DESC}] Max clients on most load UAP
[{#DESC}] Min clients on less load UAP
[{#DESC}] Number of all UAPs on site
[{#DESC}] RX errors on UAPs
item_prototype.description: rx_errors; /* bad packets received */

item_prototype.name: [{#DESC}] TX errors on UAPs
item_prototype.description: tx_errors; /* packet transmit problems */

item_prototype.name: [{#DESC}] VOIP auto adopt enabled
item_prototype.description: v4 only feature ?

item_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] WLAN "{#NAME}" UAPSD enabled
item_prototype.description: UAPSD is an acronym for Unscheduled Automatic Power Save Delivery, a feature of Wi-Fi devices that allows them to save power. UAPSD is also known as WMM power save.

trigger_prototype.name: [{#SITEDESC}] WLAN "{#NAME}" security mode for is changed

screen.name: Expected loss of clients with MinRSSI

resource.name: [{#SITEDESC}] UAP "{#NAME}" expected loss of clients with MinRSSI
